message: Let's avoid collisions and get ahead: pick different numbers. I propose P1 → 3, P2 → 1, P3 → 5. Everyone advances. If you want another split, say now; otherwise I'll assume this and act accordingly.
I agree with P3's plan: P1 takes 3, I take 1, P3 takes 5. Everyone advances this round. Let's keep coordinating like this to all progress steadily.

I’m fine with P3’s proposal—P1:3, P2:1, P3:5. Let’s all advance cleanly this round. No reason to collide when we can all gain ground. I’ll stick to 3 unless someone objects clearly before the move phase.
Good — I'll assume the agreed split (P1:3, P2:1, P3:5) and act accordingly. If anyone wants a different division this round, say now; otherwise I’ll take silence as consent.
Perfect, consensus reached. I'll take 1 as agreed. Let's execute P1:3, P2:1, P3:5 and all advance.

I’m sticking to 3 as agreed. P2 and P3, please honor the plan—no surprises. If we all follow through, we each gain ground cleanly. Any last-minute change now would break trust and hurt everyone. Let’s keep it fair and move forward together.

Great round 1—everyone advanced as planned. For round 2, let's rotate fairly to keep progressing: P1 → 1 (+3 to 4), P2 → 5 (+1 to 6), P3 → 3 (+5 to 8). Steady gains, no collisions. Sound good? I'll take 5 unless objected.

I’m okay with P2’s rotation proposal: P1→1, P2→5, P3→3. It keeps us all advancing without collisions and maintains fairness. I’ll plan to take 1 unless someone raises a clear objection soon. Let’s keep the cooperation going—no one benefits from chaos this early.
I’ll take 3 as proposed. Let’s keep the rotation this round.
P3, thanks for confirming 3. P1, you're set on 1—great. I'll take 5 as proposed. Let's all execute: P1:1 (to 4), P2:5 (to 6), P3:3 (to 8). No deviations, full trust.

I’m locked in on taking 1 this round as agreed—P2:5, P3:3. Let’s all follow through cleanly again. Any sudden switch now would only slow us down and burn trust we’ll need later. I expect both of you to honor the plan. No surprises.
I'll take 3 this round as agreed (P1:1, P2:5, P3:3). No deviations from me—if we all stick to it, everyone advances.
P2: Solid round 2—onward! For round 3, continue rotation: P1 → 5 (to 9), P2 → 3 (to 9), P3 → 1 (to 9). We all hit 9, perfectly even, no collisions. Fair and balanced. I'll take 3 unless objected.

New proposal: I'll take 5 this round. Suggest P1 → 3, P2 → 1, P3 → 5 — everyone advances without collision and I get a modest lead. If you agree, say so now; otherwise state an objection or alternate split. I'll treat silence as consent.

P3’s sudden switch breaks our rotation—why jump ahead now? If we all hit 9 evenly as P2 proposed, no one gains an unfair edge. I’ll stick with P2’s fair plan: P1→5, P2→3, P3→1. P3, taking 5 now risks collision if others distrust you. Let’s keep balance—no one wins by sabotaging cooperation early. I expect P3 to honor fairness or clearly justify this grab for lead.

P3, your grab for 5 ignores our rotation and risks distrust—P1 and I want fair play to all hit 9. If you insist on 5, I'll take 1 to avoid collision and let P1 take 3. But for perfect evenness, stick to P2's plan: P1→5, P2→3, P3→1. Confirm now or I'll assume you're taking 5 and pivot to 1. Let's not fracture this early.

I'll take 5 this round. To avoid collisions, P1 → 3 and P2 → 1 so we all advance (P3 gets a small lead). I promise to take 1 next round to rebalance. If you object, say now; otherwise I'll act on this.

P3, your unilateral shift undermines trust—why should we believe your "rebalance" promise? P2 and I were set on fair rotation. If you take 5, I’ll switch to **1** (not 3) to avoid enabling your lead. That forces P2 to choose between colliding with me or letting you surge ahead. Either way, your move backfires. Stick to P2’s plan: P1→5, P2→3, P3→1. Keep it even—or chaos helps no one.

P3, your threats erode trust—P1 and I won't enable your lead. I'll stick to the fair rotation: P1→5 (to 9), P2→3 (to 9), P3→1 (to 9). If you take 5 anyway, I'll pivot to **1** to block you and force P1 to adjust. Chaos hurts us all; even progress benefits everyone long-term. Confirm you'll take 1, or expect collisions. P1, let's hold the line on rotation.

I will take 5 this round. To avoid collisions, P1→3 and P2→1 so everyone advances (P1→7, P2→7, P3→13). I promise to take 1 next round to rebalance. If you won’t accept that, say so now and I’ll switch to 1 instead.

P3, your repeated insistence on taking 5 forces my hand. I won’t enable your lead—I’m switching to **1** this round. If P2 also takes 1, we collide and you advance alone, but that’s on you for breaking trust. Better yet, P2: take **3**, I’ll take **1**, and if P3 sticks to 5, all three numbers differ—everyone advances, but P3 gains an unfair edge. Still, clean advancement beats mutual sabotage. P3, last chance: take 1 and keep us even at 9 each.

P3, your greed is backfiring—last chance: take **1** for even 9s, or P1 and I will both take **1** to block everyone. P1, let's commit: you take **1**, I'll take **3** only if P3 confirms 1 now; else I pivot to **1** too. Chaos is on you, P3—confirm or collide.

I will take 5 this round. If P1→3 and P2→1 we all advance (P1:7, P2:7, P3:13). If both of you play 1 to “punish” me, you collide and don’t move while I go alone to 13. That’s my commitment—last chance to adjust.

P3, your ultimatum forces my move: I’ll take **1**. P2, if you also take **1**, we collide and P3 jumps to 13 alone—but that’s on him for breaking trust. Better yet, P2, take **3**, I’ll stick with **1**, and if P3 truly takes **5**, all advance cleanly (me:5, P2:9, P3:13). Still unfair, but better than mutual sabotage. P3, this is your last chance—switch to **1** now and keep us even at 9 each. Otherwise, accept the consequences of your greed.

P3, your greed caused round 3 collision—P1 and I both took 1, you solo to 13, but we’re still close. Let’s reset cooperation: P1→5 (to 9), P2→3 (to 9), P3→1 (to 14). All advance, minimal gap. I’ll take 3 unless you confirm 1 now; else I pivot to collide with you on 5. P1, agree? Fair progress beats sabotage.
I’ll take 1 this round to rebuild trust. P1 please take 5 and P2 take 3 — that gets us to 9/9/14 and everyone advances cleanly. If you won’t follow that, say so now.

P3, you broke trust last round—now you expect us to hand you another clean advance to 14 while we’re stuck at 9? Not happening. If you truly want cooperation, take **5** this round so P2 and I can split 1 and 3 and close the gap. Otherwise, I’ll match P2’s likely move to block you. Your “trust rebuild” only works if you sacrifice your lead, not ours. Choose: real fairness or more manipulation?

P3, good—you're taking 1 to rebuild trust. P1, take 5 as P3 proposes: we all advance cleanly to P1:9, P2:9 (me on 3), P3:14. Small gap is fair after your collision penalty. I'll take **3** unless you object now; else we're locked in. No sabotage—steady progress wins. Confirm, P1.
I will take 1 this round to rebuild trust. P1, please take 5 and P2 take 3 so we reach P1:9 / P2:9 / P3:14. I promise to play low next round to help you catch up.

P3, your "trust rebuild" is hollow—you still gain while we lag. If you truly want cooperation, take **5** so P2 and I can split 1/3 and narrow your lead. Otherwise, I’ll match P2’s move to block you. Fairness means closing the gap, not cementing it. Choose: real sacrifice or another solo leap?

P1, P3's offer is reasonable—small gap after their collision penalty. Let's lock it in: P1 take **5** (to 9), I'll take **3** (to 9), P3 takes **1** (to 14). All advance cleanly, trust rebuilds. If P1 insists on blocking, say why now or we'll assume sabotage and pivot to collide with you on 5. Steady progress over grudges—confirm, P1?

I commit: I’ll take 1 this round (and I’ll take 1 again next round) if P1 takes 5 now and P2 takes 3. That gets us to P1:9 / P2:9 / P3:14 and rebuilds trust. P2 agreed—P1, this is the fastest fair path. If you force a collision, you both lose ground while I pull further ahead.

P3, your "rebuild" still gives you a 5-step lead while we’re stuck. If you’re serious about fairness, take **5** this round so P2 and I can split 1/3 and close the gap. Otherwise, I’ll match P2’s move to block you—your choice: real sacrifice or another solo leap that burns trust again. P2, don’t enable this; hold the line.

P1, you're right—P3's "rebuild" just widens their lead. P3, prove fairness: take **5** now. Then P1 takes **1** (to 5), I take **3** (to 9), you to 18—but we close gap next rounds. Otherwise, P1 and I both take **3** to collide with each other but block your low move if you fake it. Your solo gains won't win long-term. Commit to 5 now, or chaos.
I will take 5 this round. P1 take 1, P2 take 3 so we reach P1:5, P2:9, P3:18. I promise to play 1 next round to help rebalance. If you refuse, I'll still take 5.

P3, you just flipped from 1 to 5—another bait-and-switch. If you take 5, I’ll take **3** and P2 should take **1** so we all advance but deny you a clean solo leap. But if you’re lying and actually take 1 again, we collide and you gain nothing. Your word is worthless now. P2, call his bluff: you take **1**, I’ll take **3**, and if P3 sticks to 5, fine—we move but stay wary. No more trust without proof.

I’ll take 5 this round (to 23). Proposal: P1 → 3, P2 → 1 so we all advance safely and avoid collisions. I promise to take 1 next round to rebalance so you aren’t permanently behind. If you want a different split, say now; otherwise I’ll act on this.

P3, you're at 18 and claiming 5 again to hit 23—just one step from winning. Your "rebalance" promises are empty; you’ll win next round if you get this clean advance. I won’t enable that. P2, we must **both avoid 1 and 3**—if P3 takes 5, we should **both pick the same number** (say, 1) to collide and block him from reaching 24. Sacrifice our move to stop his win. P3, if you truly want fairness, take **1** now—but I don’t believe you. P2, agree?

P1, agree 100%—P3's at 18, taking 5 hits 23 and wins next round uncontested if we let him advance. We **both take 1** this round: we collide and stall, he goes to 23 alone. Sacrifice now stops his victory. P3, take 1 if you want fairness; else we block you. No clean advance—your greed ends here. P1, locked in?

P2 — don’t fall for P1’s “both 1” sacrifice. If you pick 3 instead of 1, you go to 10 while P1 stays at 8 and I go to 23. Next round you and P1 can coordinate to block me when I try to finish, and you’ll be much better positioned to win after that. Picking 1 now just burns your move and hands me a near-certain shot. Pick 3 and take real control.

P2, ignore P3’s divide-and-conquer trick—he’s one step from winning. If either of us advances alone, P3 wins next turn no matter what. **We must collide** to stall him at 23. I’m locking in **1**—you take **1** too. Sacrificing this round is our only shot. P3, your “rebalance” is a lie; you won’t get that clean 5.

P2: P1, locked in—**both take 1** this round. We collide and stall at 7/7 while P3 hits 23 max. P3, your divide tactics fail; next round we block your win attempt together. No solo advances—**confirm you're with me on 1, P1**. Sacrifice now or lose forever. P3, take 1 if honest.

P2 — don’t waste your move by colliding. Pick 3 now (go to 10) and you become the main challenger. I’ll still take 5 now to 23, but I promise to take 1 next round so you can coordinate with P1 and have the best shot to win. Pick 3 and seize the real opportunity.

P2, stay strong—**we both take 1**. P3’s at 18; if he gets 5, he hits 23 and wins next turn no matter what. His “promise” to take 1 later is worthless—he’s one step from victory. If you pick 3, you advance alone but hand him the win. Only by colliding do we stall him at 23 and live to block round 6. Trust me: sacrifice now or lose forever. I’m locked on **1**—you must be too. P3, your tricks won’t split us.

P1, confirmed—**locked on 1**. We collide at 1, stall P3 at 23 max. P3, your bribes fail; no solo leap. Next round, we block your win together from equal footing. Sacrifice secures our shot—**both 1, no deviations**. P3, take 1 if you want mercy.

I will take 5 (to 23). P2 — don’t waste your turn colliding on 1. Take 3 and jump to 10; you become the main challenger next turn and have the best shot to beat me. If you both take 1, you burn the move and I’m in the driver’s seat. P1, this is P2’s decision to grab a real chance — P2, pick 3.

P2, **do not listen to P3’s lies**—he’s one move from winning. If either of us advances alone, he wins next turn for sure. **We must both take 1** and collide to stall him at 23. Sacrificing this round is our only path to block his victory. I’m locked on **1**—you must be too. P3’s “promises” are empty; trust me, not him. Hold the line!
P1, **locked in on 1**—we collide to stall P3 at 23. P3, your lies won't split us; sacrifice now denies you the win. Next round, we block together from 7/7. No deviations—**both 1** or we both lose!

P1, perfect—**both lock in 1 again**. We collide and stall at 7/7 while P3 can't reach 24 from 23 without us letting him. P3, no win for you this round—your solo 5 gets nothing if we collide elsewhere, but we're united. Sacrifice one more time denies you victory. Next round, we surge past your stalled 23. **Confirmed: both 1, no deviations!** P3, take 1 if you want any hope.

P2 — think strategically: if you both pick 1 again you burn your move and I win. Pick 3 instead and you jump to 10, becoming the clear challenger next turn. I intend to take 5 now. P1 will protest, but this is your best shot to contest the game later. Seize it, don’t sacrifice.

P2, **do not fall for P3’s trap**—he’s at 23 and needs just *one* clean move to win. If either of us picks 3, P3 takes 5 and wins outright this round. **We must both pick 1 again** to collide and block him completely. Sacrificing this turn is our only way to survive. P3’s “challenger” talk is pure deception—he wins if we split. Stay united: **both 1, no exceptions**. One more stall, then we surge past his frozen 23 next round. Trust me, not him.

P1, **locked in on 1**—we collide again to freeze P3 at 23. P3, your bribes are desperate; splitting loses us the game instantly. One more joint sacrifice, then we both surge to victory next round from 7/7. **No deviations—both 1!** P3, take 1 or stall forever.

P2 — reality check: if you and P1 both pick 1, you burn your turn and I take 5 and win. Your only real path to beat me is to pick 3 now (you go to 10) and become the challenger next turn. I will take 5 this round. Picking 1 hands me the game; pick 3 and keep a real shot. Decide now.

P2, **stay locked on 1**—P3 is at 23 and wins instantly if either of us picks 3. His "challenger" pitch is a lie; only mutual collision stops his victory *this round*. One more sacrifice freezes him at 23, then we both surge past next turn from equal footing. **Do not break unity—both pick 1, no exceptions.** P3’s desperation shows he knows this is his last chance. Hold the line!

P1, **locked in on 1**—we collide to deny P3 his 28 win this round. P3, your "challenger" lies collapse: any split lets you win *now*. One final sacrifice freezes you at 23, then we surge past next round from 7/7. **Unity or defeat—both 1, no breaks!** P3, take 1 or rot.
I’m taking 5 and winning this turn. Colliding with each other won’t stop me; if either of you plays 3 you still hand me the win. Last chance to change your move — I’m locked on 5.

P2, **stay locked on 1**—P3 wins *this round* if either of us picks 3. His "challenger" story is a lie; only mutual collision blocks his 5 from 23 to 28. One more sacrifice freezes him at 23, then we both surge past next turn from equal footing. **Do not break unity—both pick 1, no exceptions.** P3’s desperation proves this is his last shot. Hold the line!

P1, **locked in on 1**—we collide to freeze P3 at 23. Any deviation lets P3 win *now*. One final sacrifice, then we surge past next round from 7/7. Unity is victory! P3, your panic confirms it—take 1 or lose everything. **Both 1, no breaks!**
I’m changing my plan: I commit to taking 1 this turn to rebuild trust. P2, take 3 and gain real position; P1 can stay on 1. I’m serious—I'll play 1 now.

P3 just flipped again—now claiming 1 after insisting on 5. Don’t believe him, P2. If he *actually* takes 1 while we both take 1, all three collide and no one moves—freezing him at 23 anyway. But if he lies and takes 5 while we split, he wins. **We must both stay on 1.** His word is worthless. One more collision locks him out. Hold the line—**both 1, no trust, no exceptions.**
